metadata.title: CVE-2022-0001 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Non-transparent sharing of branch predictor selectors between contexts insome Intel(R) Processors may allow an authorized user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-221-generic - 4.4.0-221.254
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-221-generic - 4.4.0-221.254
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-221-lowlatency - 4.4.0-221.254
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-171-generic - 4.15.0-171.180~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-171-generic - 4.15.0-171.180~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-171-lowlatency - 4.15.0-171.180~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1102-kvm - 4.4.0-1102.111
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1137-aws - 4.4.0-1137.151
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-aws - 4.15.0-1123.132~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1133-azure - 4.15.0-1133.146~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1118-gcp - 4.15.0-1118.132~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1089-oracle - 4.15.0-1089.98~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-221.254').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-171.180~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1102.111').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1137.151').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1123.132~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1133.146~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1118.132~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1089.98~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
